intro: Rhynchospora minor, commonly known as the small beak sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically blooming in late summer. Rhynchospora minor is often found in shallow water or moist soil, contributing to the ecological diversity of wetland ecosystems. Its presence is an indicator of healthy, undisturbed wetland environments.
